item.title: Fish hospital opens in Khulna to treat diseased fish
item.description: Usually people visit hospitals when sick, now fish in Khulna can also receive medical care. A specialised fish hospital, ‘Fish Square Fisheries Hospital,’ was inaugurated in Dumuria of Khulna on Friday afternoon, to provide treatment and advice for fish diseases and aquaculture issues.

item.title: 2 Chinese nationals taken into custody over ‘unauthorised travel’
item.description: Police in Khagrachhari’s Ramgarh have taken two Chinese nationals into custody, saying they travelled to the hill district “without permission”. Police seized laptops and several other electronic devices from the duo—Jiang Chengtong and Teng Tonggui. Ramgarh Police Chief M

item.title: DUCSU announces Bengali New Year celebration in Agrahayan
item.description: The Dhaka University Central Students’ Union (DUCSU) has announced that it will celebrate Bengali New Year at the start of Agrahayan rather than on the traditional first day of Boishakh. The newly elected DUCSU leadership intends to organise the event on Sunday, the first day of the Bengali

item.title: Govt plans to develop economic zone in Bhola
item.description: The government has a plan to develop an economic zone at the gas-rich Bhola district as many reputed companies have expressed their desire to set up industries in Bhola. Power, Energy and Mineral Resources Adviser Muhammad Fouzul Kabir Khan, Industries Adviser Adilur Rahman Khan and Commerce Advis

item.title: Auto driver beaten to death in Brahmanbaria
item.description: An autorickshaw driver was beaten to death on Friday in Bijoynagar upazila of Brahmanbaria district after his vehicle allegedly hit a motorcycle. The deceased was identified as Mohammad Delwar Hossain, 45, also known as Dilu Mia of Chanpur village in Paharpur union under the same upazila and son o

item.title: Man killed in Jhenaidah road crash
item.description: A youth was killed and two others were injured in a head-on collision between two motorcycles in Kaliganj upazila of Jhenaidah on Friday evening. The deceased was identified as Suman Hossain, 22, son of Abdul Mannan of Baliadanga village in Kaliganj. The injured are Toukir Ahmed of Bhutiarghati vi

item.description: Usually people visit hospitals when sick, now fish in Khulna can also receive medical care. A specialised fish hospital, ‘Fish Square Fisheries Hospital,’ was inaugurated in Dumuria of Khulna on Friday afternoon, to provide treatment and advice for fish diseases and aquaculture issues.

item.title: Unleashing the youth dividend in Bangladesh

This is because it is a country which is situated at a critical point in its national journey. item.title: Ensuring smooth walking for pedestrians
item.description: Around two-fifths of the daily commuters in Dhaka walk to reach their destinations, whereas the ratio was one-fifth two decades ago. The data are impressive, no doubt, especially since the city is not particularly conducive to smooth walking. There is a lack of safe, accessible and efficient infras

item.title: When climate crisis meets corruption
item.description: Bangladesh stands among the world's most climate-vulnerable nations, not only in statistical rankings but in the lived experience of millions. The country has entered an era in which the scale and frequency of natural disasters can no longer be predicted within familiar seasonal or geographical pat

item.title: Poverty rising, jobs squeezing, social parameters worsening
item.description:
Poverty is rising, employment shrinking and key social indicators in Bangladesh are deteriorating, says a presentation at an international meet in Dhaka about a setback on the national economic front and its spillovers.
Despite these negative trends, however, people of Bangladesh have not

item.title: Stimulating investment in blue economy
item.description: The size of the investment that the formal lending institutions, that is, banks, have already made or are willing to make in a particular sector of the economy is indicative of the particular sector's importance in the economy. From that perspective, the blue economy does not seem to play a substan
